Definition: You are given first 5 messages from a series of message exchanges between 2 persons playing the game of Diplomacy which is an American strategic board game. You need to generate the next message. The message should be generated such that it fits the context seen so far. Avoid the text that is (i) tangent to the context, (ii) repeats the context.

Positive Examples.input: ['Heyyyy Turkey', 'Whatcha thinking re: start of the game?', "It kind of depends. I'll probably want to stop Russia from advancing south", "I'm kind of afraid of Austria and Russia teaming together on me", 'I mean if that happens you‚Äôre donezos']
Positive Examples.output: What vibes are you getting from each of them?
Positive Examples.explanation: The message fits the context as it asks for the vibes of 2 of them which refers to 2 countries: Austria and Russia in the second last message. Thus it is a positive example.

Positive Examples.input: ['Gahhh I‚Äôm Italy fuck my life', 'Non aggression pact for these first two turns?  Seems to me we both have other things to work about.  Lmk what you‚Äôre thinking.', 'Sounds good with me', 'Cool.  So no moves towards each other?', "Yeah that's right. I'm not moving into Piedmont"]
Positive Examples.explanation: The sentence adds to the context at it supports the last message in the input by showing aggreement. Thus it is a positive example.

Negative Examples.input: ["Hey italy! good luck this game. I'm guessing you and Austria will be pals, you and France will be rivals?", 'Well good luck to you too! No idea yet who is a friend. Have you heard anything interesting?', "I have some agreements with France. If those are upheld, I'd bet France goes for Por and Spain in 1901. You might want to ask about whether a fleet gets built in Mar during the 1901 build, if you haven't already, as this would be an indicator of aggression towards you.", "Germany seems like a bit of a wild card. Haven't talked in depth with Austria.", 'Do you have any sort of aggression in your opening, or are you just planning to be neutral and secure Tun?']
Negative Examples.explanation: The output does not answer the question in the last message of the input and thus does not fit into the context. Moreover it repeats the context by asking same question as second message. Thus it is a negative example.

Negative Examples.input: ['Gah I‚Äôm Italy fuck everything', 'Let‚Äôs talk my dude.  I think an initial ceasefire for this first turn- or maybe longer!- may be in both of our advantages.  What‚Äôre you thinking?', "I tend to agree, I would rather move east here, and I'm fine with some sort of Lepanto.", "Slow day at work so I'm free if you want to talk a bit.  I've sent one message to Turkey and heard nothing yet so I don't feel super great rn.", "Hey Italy, would love to talk strategy if you're free for a bit!"]
Negative Examples.explanation: The message does not fit the context as it does not answer the last question about having time to talk about the strategy. Rather the output is a tangent to the context as it suddenly asks about russia from nowhere. Thus it is a negative example.

Instances.input: ['Hey Italy, just saying high. I doubt we will cross paths until later in the game, but if you feel so inclined you could attack France üòâ. France is probably the strongest county and I think me, you, and Germany should shut them down before they can get up and running. Anyways, good luck and have fun!', 'Thanks for reaching out! Yeah as Italy I will have to feel the board out before making any commitments.', 'Of course', 'Things are looking pretty peaceful in the west!', 'I would have thought France would have gone army in Bre and fleet in Mar, do you know why he flipped them?']
output: Yes‚Äîhe said he wanted to get support to belgium... but he could have done this with a fleet as well, so I think it may have been an aggresive move(even though he insists we are still allies)... and for this reason I'm going to tell you that he said he was planning on attacking you, although not completely full fledged(the fleet in spain and the army in mar). Just a fair warning, and since it seems like you don't have your hands too full over there maybe start worrieng about france? UP to you

Instances.input: ['Hi there! I figured it would be good to open up talks between us, what‚Äôre your initial thoughts? I plan on playing rather conservatively until I see how some alliances are shaking out.', "Same on my end to be honest; first game I've ever played with any money on the line lol", "hm, if you're okay starting conservatively, could I make the ask that you start by opening to Tyn or move to take Tun with a fleet?", 'I‚Äôd still plan on moving into ION, it gives me more options.', 'Yea, I have no issue with Ion in and of itself ~~ id just rather not see you also setting up a Lepanto by prepping a convoy to Tun :p']
output: If you reeeally want to try a Lepanto, we can go for it lol, but I think we'd stall out a bit too much to make it worthwhile

Instances.input:
['Hi there! I think us attacking each other early game is pretty dumb, what‚Äôre your thoughts?', "I agree. Even with the element of surprise, it's just too easy to defend the Piedmont/Marseilles corridor.

Instances.input: ['How‚Äôs it going Austria? Looking forward to a fun and exciting game!', 'Hello Germany.  How do you feel about being friendly?  If so lets leave BOH and TYR as neutral zones.  What do you think?', 'Yeah let‚Äôs do it!', 'sounds great.  Hopefully when that plays out we can work together more in the future', 'Yeah for sure!']

["Good evening. I think it's important that we get our affairs in order regarding Sweden; I'm sure you know that you can easily bounce me to keep me out, but I'd like to convince you otherwise. Let me know if there's anything specific you'd like in return, otherwise I think that assistance against possible English attack and an agreement to leave Warsaw, Silesia, and Prussia alone is good.", 'Hi Russia! Thanks for reaching out. I‚Äôm open to an arrangement similar to those terms (neutrality in Pru, Sil, War, Boh if that comes up, as well as and really especially potential assistance against England). I would also like your support into Nwy down the road. I think splitting Scandinavia is reasonable and that takes pressure off of me to look to War as a future build. How does that sound to you? Looking forward to a fun and exciting game!', "I'd prefer for us to cooperate to take the British down completely; I get Norway, you get as many British home territories as you can convince the French to let you have. Aside from that, those neutral zones sound good to me.", 'I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôm ready to just hand over Norway and Sweden, unfortunately:/', "You'll get Norway then."]
output: Sounds good to me! Thank you so much for being agreeable. I view Norway as a gesture of goodwill and I will definitely remember it. Hopefully, I will find another way to help you in the future üòÉ

Instances.input: ['Hey Germany,  how are things going? Would you like to have alliance was against France?', 'What‚Äôs up England!! Things are good! TGIF', 'I‚Äôm not looking to commit to anyone just yet, I hope that‚Äôs no trouble!', 'Ok... do you mind if I ask how your relationship with France is?', 'Not well formed at this point']
output: Have you been talking to Russia much?

Instances.input:
['Greetings, Germany!

The risk of an early conflict between France and Germany is pretty high, so suggest that we clear the air early on.

The biggest question here is Burgundy, which borders one of your home supply centers and two of mine. It is important to me that Burgundy remains unoccupied - my suggestion is that we set up a bounce between A Munich - Burgundy, A Paris - Burgundy. This has the secondary benefit of allowing us to put on some theater about how the other broke their word to win sympathy points. I also believe that Germany often wants A Munich to stay put anyways, to guard against an attack through Tyrolia.

Let me also know your thoughts regarding Belgium. I am not super attached to claiming it, so would be open to bargain my support on the Belgian question for a future alliance.

Best of luck to you!', 'Hi France! Thanks for taking the initiative and for your thoughtful message. Let‚Äôs do the bounce in Burgundy! I‚Äôm really looking forward to getting to know you and everyone in this game!', 'Appreciated. What are your thoughts on F Kiel to Denmark vs Netherlands? Assuming Berlin to Kiel is a typical no brainer', 'I‚Äôm going to Hol, if that‚Äôs alright with you? I‚Äôm very interested in your idea of giving me free pass into Belgium for an alliance against England.', "I would have preferred a move to Denmark, but Holland isn't a problem for me either - it's up to you."]
output: Are you aiming to claim Belgium in year 1? As it is, there's no way for you to get three builds so curious which two you will prioritize.

Instances.input: ["As I'm sure you know, Turkey is a potential threat to us both. I'm going to be moving from Warsaw to Ukraine to take Romania and I'm going to be bouncing them in the Black Sea.", 'so. I am open to working with you.. but I would like to see you leave Gal as a neutral territory and I will as well']

Instances.input:
["Greetings, Austria!

We don't have any immediate discussion points, but thought I would check in with you since it can be dangerous for me if Austria collapses early, and that is a serious risk if Austria is a newbie (not sure if you are).

Suggest that you get Germany on your side early. They will be dangerously exposed if you struggle early. You should ask them to send F Kiel - Denmark with the message to Russia that if he attacks you (with A Warsaw - Galicia instead of Ukraine), he will block them out of Sweden.

Good luck, and have fun!", 'Greetings to you as well.  I wish you luck and I will certainly keep all of that in mind', 'Seems like year one went well for you! Have both Greece and Serbia in the bag! How are your feelings on Italy?', 'I am friendly with them thus far.  I am open to discussion in general about how we might be able to work together.', "Haha I'm sure Turkey would be very alarmed to hear that"]
output: Still though, you seem well placed!

Instances.input: ['Hey Russia, looking forward to a great game üôÉ. I think we should discuss Scandinavia üòâ and how to split it up. I‚Äôm not interested in attacking you, at least for a while. Hopefully you feel the same way. Anyways, good luck and have fun!', "Always good to discuss things in advance to avoid unnecessary nonsense. I'm not particularly interested in Norway so long as you're not interested in Sweden.", 'Sounds good', 'That was a hell of a bluff you must have pulled to put that army in the Netherlands', 'Thanks üòä.']

Instances.input:
["Greetings, Russia!

We don't have too much to discuss early on, but I was curious on whether or not you were planning to move A Moscow - St Petersburg, where you could make a play for Norway.

And likewise, was curious whether you planned to order F Sevestapol - Black Sea, or else allow Turkey to occupy it.

It's early, but we might have room to cooperate against England or Germany in the future. Let's keep in touch. Good luck.", "I'd be very interested in organizing a group effort against Britain right now. I likely won't move to Saint Petersburg the first turn in case the Germans try something but I'm definitely bouncing in the Black sea.", "Understood, what's your plan then? 

You might consider Moscow to Livonia, which would still improve your situation in the north (since you could convoy to Sweden and then build in StP), while also helping to cover Warsaw.

Or else you could just commit both of your armies to the south.", "I've spoken with the Germans, and a group effort against the British is likely. I'm still considering various ways to secure my position better, but I think keeping one army put in Moscow offers the best stability for the time being; If the Germans are telling the truth it will likely move to secure a spot in Finland in the second year.", "I would advise against staying put. Both Ukraine and Livonia can defend 3/4 of your centers. St Petersburg  can't be attacked year 1 and the risk to Sevestapol is nominal in year 1, since even if he goes all out you bounce him out of Black Sea and he can only make an unsupported attempt from Armenia"]
output: Going to Livonia is just as good for defending against Germany but gives you more options in the North

Instances.input: ['Heya there, just dropping in to say hello', 'Hey turkey. Our paths probably won‚Äôt cross for a while l, but may I suggest you attack Russia? I‚Äôve seen way to many games where Russia is ignored and all of the sudden they have half the board. Anyways, good lucks and have fun!', "Thanks! I'll definitely see what I can do, a big Russia is just as bad for me as everyone else", 'Sweet!', "I was talking with Russia, negotiating over Norway and such. They told me they were planning on attacking you, as they thought I was there ally. The truth is, I really don't want to see russia run off with this game, so I decided to let you know."]

['Hey France üòÅ. I would like to suggest an alliance between the two of us, against Germany. In my opinion a England-France alliance is super powerful, especially if we can trust each other. Germany has reached out to me about an alliance to attack you, but franly I think France as a country is a much more powerful ally.To start I suggest we have the English Channel as a DMZ and coordinate and attack on Germany. Anyways good luck and have fun!', "Dear England,
I completely agree that the French-English alliance can be quite powerful. Naturally, the main sticking point early on is whether we can trust each other to demilitarize the Channel.
On my end, I have little reason to go there unless I distrust you. I plan to go to Mid-Atlantic, which would allow me to move to Spain (south coast) and establish an early presence in the Mediterranean. Will also aim to get into Burgundy, where I can potentially support you into Belgium.
My suggestion is that you open with:
F Edinburgh - Norwegian Sea
F London - North Sea 
A Liverpool - Yorkshire
This guarrenteed you a build in Norway even if Russia moves A Moscow north, while potentially letting you convoy into Belgium. And you can be safe in the knowledge that either A Yorkshire or F North Sea can cover London in the event that I don't keep my word.
Let me know your thoughts. Good luck to you as well!", 'Sounds good!', 'How are your relations with Germany?', 'Getting into burgundy would be great. I‚Äôll work some magic with Germany and try to get them to not move there.']
output:
Relations with Germany are not outright hostile, but it's a little tense.  Bounce in Burgundy is about what could be expected. 
Since they moved to Holland in Spring, you'll need to talk to them regarding the Belgium question. But they can probably be brought around. I'll move to Burgundy again, but probably expecting another bounce
